meanings.definition: To acclimate or adjust again to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: After moving to a colder place, she reacclimatizes by wearing warmer clothes.
meanings.sent2: The tropical bird reacclimatizes to the cooler weather in the winter.
meanings.sent3: The penguin reacclimatizes to the warm climate by taking frequent swims.
meanings.sent4: Just like a chameleon changes colors, she reacclimatizes to different environments effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: His ability to reacclimatize quickly makes him a great traveler.

meanings.definition: To become accustomed to a new climate or environment again.
meanings.sent1: She reacclimatizes to the desert heat after spending a year in the mountains.
meanings.sent2: The migratory birds reacclimatize every year when they return to their nesting grounds.
meanings.sent3: The fish reacclimatizes to the clear water after being in a murky pond.
meanings.sent4: Her mind reacclimatizes to the hustle and bustle of the city after a peaceful vacation.
meanings.sent5: The plant reacclimatizes to the sunlight after being kept in the shade for too long.
